intro: Aulomyrcia obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed heath, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreen plants. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in pine and oak woodlands. Its leaves are broad and elliptical, and it produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. Aulomyrcia obovata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
